title: Chicken and Broccoli Alfredo
ingredients: 2 boneless, skinless chicken breasts, thinly sliced
Salt and black pepper to taste
instructions: Cook the fettuccine pasta according to package instructions. Drain and set aside.
In a large skillet, melt butter over medium heat. Add sliced chicken and cook until no longer pink.
Add minced garlic and cook for an additional 1-2 minutes.
Stir in heavy cream, Parmesan cheese, and broccoli florets. Cook until the sauce thickens and broccoli is tender.
Season with salt and black pepper to taste.
Add the cooked fettuccine to the skillet, tossing to coat the pasta with the sauce.
Serve the Chicken and Broccoli Alfredo hot, garnished with chopped parsley.

title: Black Bean and Corn Salad
ingredients: 2 cans (15 oz each) black beans, drained and rinsed
instructions: In a large bowl, combine black beans, corn, diced bell pepper, chopped red onion, and cilantro.
In a small bowl, whisk together lime juice, olive oil, ground cumin, salt, and pepper.
Pour the dressing over the black bean mixture and toss to combine.
Refrigerate for at least 30 minutes to let the flavors meld.
Serve the Black Bean and Corn Salad chilled as a side dish or with tortilla chips.

title: Blueberry Lemon Muffins
instructions: Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C). Line a muffin tin with paper liners.
In a large bowl, whisk together flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt.
In another bowl, whisk together milk, melted butter, eggs, vanilla extract, and lemon zest.
Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and stir until just combined.
Fold in the fresh blueberries.
Divide the batter evenly among the muffin cups.
Bake for 18-20 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
Allow the muffins to cool in the tin for 5 minutes before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely.

title: Grilled Salmon with Lemon Dill Sauce
instructions: Preheat the grill to medium-high heat.
In a small bowl, whisk together olive oil, lemon juice, minced garlic, dried dill, salt, and pepper.
Brush the salmon fillets with the prepared lemon dill sauce.
Grill the salmon for 4-5 minutes per side or until cooked to your liking.
Serve the grilled salmon with additional lemon wedges and drizzle with any remaining sauce.

title: Vegetarian Quinoa Bowl
ingredients: 1 can (15 oz) black beans, drained and rinsed
instructions: In a medium saucepan, combine quinoa and vegetable broth. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat, cover, and simmer for 15-20 minutes or until quinoa is cooked and liquid is absorbed.
Fluff the quinoa with a fork and let it cool to room temperature.
In a large bowl, combine cooked quinoa, black beans, cherry tomatoes, cucumber, avocado, feta cheese, and cilantro.
Drizzle with lime juice and toss gently to combine.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve the vegetarian quinoa bowl chilled.

title: Homemade Margherita Pizza
instructions: Preheat the oven to the highest setting (usually around 475°F or 245°C).
Roll out the pizza dough on a floured surface to your desired thickness.
Transfer the rolled-out dough to a pizza stone or baking sheet.
Spread a thin layer of tomato sauce over the dough, leaving a small border around the edges.
Arrange tomato slices and mozzarella cheese on top of the sauce.
Drizzle with olive oil and season with salt and pepper.
Bake in the preheated oven for 12-15 minutes or until the crust is golden and the cheese is melted and bubbly.
Remove from the oven, sprinkle fresh basil leaves on top, and let it cool slightly before slicing.

title: Spaghetti Bolognese
instructions: Cook spaghetti according to package instructions.
In a large skillet, brown the ground beef over medium heat.
Add chopped onions and garlic, sauté until onions are translucent.
Stir in crushed tomatoes, red wine, oregano, salt, and pepper.
Simmer for 20-30 minutes until the sauce thickens.
Serve the Bolognese sauce over cooked spaghetti, topped with Parmesan cheese.

title: Chicken Stir Fry
ingredients: 500g boneless, skinless chicken breast, thinly sliced
instructions: In a wok or large skillet, heat vegetable oil over high heat.
Add sliced chicken and cook until browned and cooked through.
Add ginger and garlic, stir-fry for 1-2 minutes.
Add bell pepper, broccoli, and carrots. Stir-fry until vegetables are tender-crisp.
In a small bowl, mix soy sauce, oyster sauce, and sesame oil. Pour over the chicken and vegetables.
Stir until everything is well coated and heated through.
Serve over cooked rice.

title: Chocolate Chip Cookies
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
In a large bowl, cream together butter, white sugar, and brown sugar until smooth.
Beat in the eggs one at a time, then stir in the vanilla.
In a separate bowl, combine flour, baking soda, baking powder, and salt.
Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients and mix until just blended.
Stir in the chocolate chips.
Drop rounded tablespoons of dough onto ungreased baking sheets.
Bake for 10-12 minutes or until edges are golden brown.
Allow cookies to cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring to wire racks to cool completely.
